conbody.p: IdlLABIdlLAB is the software that controls the IDL language lab. Its main window can be seen in .

row.entry: Teacher name (advanced mode only) and current class

conbody.p:
Upon startup IdlLAB starts looking for an audio hub connected to the computer. Indicator (7) will start blinking green once connection to the hub has been successfully established.
Connection indicator
Connection indicator
An error message will pop up on your screen ( ) if the software fails to contact an audio hub within reasonable time.
Open a previously existing class file or create a new class (see ) to start an IdlLAB session.
The teacher can then proceed with a roll cal registration of the student to check their attendance (see ).
conbody.note: As a rule, every student in the class has to be a member of a group (see ). Otherwise they will not be able to take part in any activity.
conbody.p: Right click on an icon of a student not belonging to any group and select a group from the drop down menu to assign the student to a group. You can also set student name from the same menu.
Right click on an icon of a student who is a member of a group to display the student menu (see ).
Select Whole class tab (2) to perform actions to all the students in the class (see ).
Select a group (3) to perform actions upon specific group in the class (see ).
Select the Audio tab to use teacher PC as a sound source or for recording (see ).
